text.textblock: Boundary Description, Big Thicket National Preserve
That Portion Lying Within Hardin County

The lands described below are derived from National Park Service Map Number 175-80008, copies of which are available for public inspection in the office of the National Park Service, Department of the Interior and the offices of the Superintendent of the preserve.

Part of A-74 described as follows: Beginning at Turkey Creek Unit angle point no. 77; Thence, Northwesterly, approximately 10,000 feet, along the northerly gradient boundary of Village Creek; Thence, N. 01
’ W., 1600 feet along the West line of said A-74; Thence, S. 70
’ W., 900 feet, along the common line between the Turkey Creek Unit and said A-74, to the Point of Beginning.
Part of A-400 described as follows: Beginning at the Northeast corner of said A-400; Thence, S. 03
’ E., 2250 feet, along the East line of said A-400; Thence, N. 81
’ W., 1750 feet, along the West line of A-400; Thence, Southeasterly, approximately 4500 feet, along the southerly gradient boundary of Village Creek, to the Point of Beginning.
Part of A-165 described as follows: Beginning at the Northeast corner of said A-165; Thence, S. 03
’ E., 1750 feet along the East line of A-165; Thence, N. 60
’ W., 300 feet along the East line of lands of United States of America, National Park Service; Thence, N. 16
’ W., 1200 feet; Thence, Southeasterly, approximately 5500 feet, along the southerly gradient boundary of Village Creek, to the Point of Beginning.

Part of A-257 described as follows: Beginning at the Southeast corner of said A-257; Thence, Northwesterly, approximately 2250 feet, along the northerly gradient boundary of Village Creek; Thence, N. 01
’ W., 700 feet along the common line between J. N. Cotten survey, A-534 and said A-257; Thence, S. 70
’ E., 1600 feet, along the common line between George Brown Heirs survey, A-74 and said A-257, to the Point of Beginning.

Also Beginning at the point of intersection of the West right-of-way line of U.S. Highway 69 and 287 with the northerly gradient boundary of Village Creek; Thence, Westerly, approximately 350 feet, along the northerly gradient boundary of Village Creek; Thence, N. 20
’ W., 1800 feet, along the East right-of-way line of Southern Pacific Railroad; Thence, N. 88
’ E., 1750 feet along the West right-of-way line of U.S. Highway 69 and 287, to the Point of Beginning.
Also Beginning at the point of intersection of the West line of the tract of land now or formerly owned by G.N. Christian,
A-257-24, with the northerly gradient boundary of Village Creek; Thence, Northwesterly, approximately 8000 feet, along the northerly gradient boundary of Village Creek; Thence, N. 02
’ W., 1300 feet, along the East line of the tract of land now or formerly owned by Watson and Watson, A-257-86-A; Thence, S. 59
’ E., 2050 feet, to the Point of Beginning.

Part of A-534 described as follows: Beginning at the point of intersection of the West right-of-way line of U.S. Highway 69 and 287 with the northerly gradient boundary of Village Creek; Thence, N. 11
’ W., 1250 feet, along the East right-of-way line of said U.S. Highway 69 and 287; Thence S. 70
’ E., 700 feet, along the East line of said A-534; Thence, Northwesterly, approximately 1400 feet, along the northerly gradient boundary of Village Creek, to the Point of Beginning.
